Tucson walks over to the wall of debris, and examines it carefully.  By run=
ning a clawed finger over it, he could tell how tightly packed it was.  Tou=
ch would serve him well, as he remembers training with just his hands, ears=
 and sense of smell to guide him.  And so he closes his eyes, going back to=
 the days of his training with Master Yoketron.  

" The walls may seem an =
impossible barrier, but the eyes can only perceive a fraction of what is re=
ally in front of you.  Embrace your other senses, see with your hands, ears=
, feet and nose, rather than with your eyes.  Feel what must be felt and se=
nse what must be sensed.  Yes Master Yoketron, I remember what you taught m=
e. "

He takes a slow step away from the wall of debris.  Takes a few deep =
breaths. And with eyes completely shut, he puts his hands together as if sl=
ipping into some form of deep meditation.  Straight Shot looks to her broth=
er and then to Leo and the others.

" Guys, step back, I've seen this befor=
e, it's a maneuver Master Yoketron taught him and it's a doozy.  Gee I sure=
 hope it works."

Quickstride and Rattrap move back.

" Okay, I definitely =
sense he's up ta something we haven't seen him do yet."

With serene poise,=
 and peaceful grace, Tucson begins with a form of Tai Chi, that appears har=
mless to those who know nothing of Ninjabot training.  Yet if Magmatron kne=
w of it, perhaps he may know what would come next.  Ever so gradually, Tucs=
on begins to move faster and faster as feet seem to lift off the ground bef=
ore they even touch it, and then it comes.  He lifts his body off the groun=
d and spin kicks the wall, with great force, attempting to weaken the wall.=


Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things you alrea=
dy posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On Jan 20, 2012=
, at 4:21 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> On 1/18/12=
, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> > Tucson looks to Optimus a=
s he's bathed in the fire. Yet, instead of
> > charging in as the others wo=
uld have thought he'd do, Tucson remains put and
> > in a train of quiet th=
ought. So much so that he gave such an emotionless
> > gaze as if in deep m=
editation. Yoketron had taught him not to act in
> > complex situations but=
 to think instead, of a way to cleverly get around a
> > tough spot.
> >
> =
> He looks at the fungi growing in the cavern, and the stalagmites and
> > =
stalactites and sniffs the moisture rich air around them.
> >
> > "Water. I=
t feeds the plants and ground even this far down. Fire, as
> > powerful as =
it is, it yet has one weakness. And what gives life to the
> > vegetation, =
brings death to the flames of fire. And even more so of an
> > enemy to fla=
mes is the cold earth that is beneath our feet. But we haven't
> > got time=
 to dig, we need water and I sense it, all around us. If we can
> > access =
the water we can put out the fire."
> 
> OOC: Smart move SANDY!!!!!!!!!
> 
=
> LEO PRIME looked around, his shapr optics scanning the surrounding
> room=
. "I can smell it too. But where was it coming from?"
> 
> "There." The voi=
ce was not that of one of the MAXIMALS it was CRYOTEK
> as he walked up and=
 looked around. He was pointing at a small river of
> water running along t=
he center of the cavern. It was perhaps a foot of
> so wide, running right =
at the columb of fire but then cleverly
> diverted to go around it by rocks=
 and stone.
> 
> Looking back to where the water has come from the remains =
of a tunnel
> can be seen, but it has been dammed up by stone and even bits=
 of
> metal.
> 
> "What are they doing?" TORCA said as he looked over at th=
e group by
> OPTIMUS PRIME. MAGMATRON had approached the figure of OPTIMUS =
PRIME
> and was watching as cables were connected to him and then to OPTIMU=
S
> PRIME.
> 
> SABERBACK was just watching MAGMATRON, his stance cold and =
brooding.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
>
